request.description: This method will get the address list of user present in server session. The user in session can be anonymous user or logged in user. Note: - Either use the GetAnonymousCustomerRecord method to get the anonymous user or log in using SignIn customer method to make use of this method as it uses RequireCustomerRecordWebAPIFilter filter which checks for existence for customer record in session.

request.description: This method is used to get the list of countries and states associated with that country to show it on save new address or update existing address pages. This is the responsibility of client to get the selected country and state while updating the address as client has to make two different calls to get the customer addresses first and then select the country and state from that address.

request.description: This method is used to either insert a new address for customer or update the existing address of the customer. The object AddressModel is used to get the data. If addressId is present in the object the address is updated else a new address is added. Note: -This method requires to pass the Auth Code in the request headers to verify the genuine request.

request.description: This method is used to make the provided address either as primary shipping address or primary billing address or both depending on the data provided. The object AddressModel is used to get the input data. Only AddressId and MakePrimaryBillingAddress / MakePrimaryShippingAddress properties are used rest can be set blank for this operation. Note: -This method requires to pass the Auth Code in the request headers to verify the genuine request.

request.description: This method is used to delete the provided address in the input object. The object AddressModel is used to get the data. The addressId is must for this operation all other properties may be left blank as only addressId is used to delete the address. Note: -This method requires to pass the Auth Code in the request headers to verify the genuine request.

header.description: (Required) It is testing tool specific header. It should be sent if any testing tool is sending request. Like Swagger or Postman

request.description:
This methode can set either affiliate or currency or both of these in one go. If just affiliate is changed then send the existing currency and changed affiliate. For changing the currency only, send the existing affiliate and changed currency.
In case of unknowm Affiliate id is sent, Defalut AffiliateID and Defalut Currency will be set. In case unknown Currency is sent, given affiliate id and Defalut currency will be set.
AjaxResponse.ResultObject will have changed affiliate and currency in AffiliateModel object. 
AjaxResponse.ResultCode can have following values (0-> Exception)(1-> Affiliate and Currency changes done successfully.) (2-> Affiliate changes done successfully) 
(3-> Currency changes done successfully.) (4-> Defalut Currency set as provided currency is not valid.) (5-> Affiliate changes done successfully, Defalut Currency set as provided currency is not valid.) 
(6-> Affiliate and Currency changed to defalut values as provided affiliate does not exist.) (7-> No changes are done. Server has same data.)

</body>
</html>

request.description: This method is used to get the Auth Token. This Auth Token is used as the way to Authenticate valid user requests. This token requires the Customer Record to be present in the application session. This token is tied to existing customer session so if the customer logs out and logs back in a new token should be requested by the client. Note: - Either use the GetAnonymousCustomerRecord method to get the anonymous user or log in using SignIn customer method to have a valid user session in the server to make application work properly.

request.description: This method is used to create a new customer record. This method requires CustomerGenericDataModel object to create the user. This method just creates the user and client should call different methods to update the website optional terms and the address details in separate calls. The output object has the different result codes to let client know about validation fails at server like existing email id use, errors while executing password rules, minimum data required rules etc. Note: -This method requires the anonymous user to be present in session to create the user. This check is done by the RequireCustomerRecordWebAPIFilter Filter attribute. If not, present error result is sent back.

request.description: This method is used to update the generic data of a existing customer record. This method requires CustomerGenericDataModel object to update the user. exec: //This API response is variable as per a database calendar schedule, for when NZ phone lines are open.
//2Hrs before an opening or closing time the message will change to "Lines are opening in {}" or "Lines are closing in {}".
//If closed, the message will read "Lines are opening in {}".
//If currently open and not within 2 hrs of closing, the message will read "Lines are open now".
//If currently closed and not within 2hrs of opening time, the message will read the next available open time "Lines are opening in {}"
//The database is currently set to open at 06:00 and close at 14:00 Mon to Sat, with Sun 07:00 to 14:00 NZST.

pm.expect(jsonData.products[0].summary).is.to.equal("Allegra tablets 120mg contain fexofenadine 180mg, which is an antihistamine that blocks the action of histamine in allergic reactions, and they are used to treat symptoms of allergic rhinitis (runny itchy nose and sneezing) and urticaria or hives (red itchy limps on the skin).");

// pm.expect(jsonData.products[0].description).is.to.equal("

Allegra general information

What is Allegra used for?

Allegra tablets 120mg are used to relieve symptoms of seasonal allergy to pollen, also known as hay fever, and perennial allergy, such as allergy to animal fur, mould and house dust mites, which both cause allergic rhinitis with symptoms including nasal congestion, runny itchy nose, sneezing, tearing, itchy, red, and puffy eyes and problems sleeping. Allegra tablets 120mg are also used to relieve symptoms of allergic skin conditions like urticaria (hives), which is an allergic reaction of the skin, usually to a medicine, food, a bee or wasp sting, or direct contact with an allergen like latex; or chronic idiopathic urticaria, which is often due to autoimmune disease, and appears as red, raised, itchy lumps on the skin. Allegra tablets relieve symptoms of an allergic reaction but do not cure the allergy.

How does Allegra work?

Allegra tablets 120mg contain the antihistamine fexofenadine, which blocks the action of histamine, a chemical that is released from mast cells, which are involved in allergic reactions. Histamine binds to the H1 receptor in small blood vessels causing them to leak, allowing white blood cells and blood proteins into the tissues to respond to allergens like pollen, causing tissue swelling, over production of mucus and irritation. Fexofenadine in Allegra tablets 180mg is an H1 receptor antagonist, and by blocking histamine binding to its receptor Allegra tablets 10mg reduce the symptoms of allergic rhinitis caused by the actions of histamine, like nasal congestion, itchy eyes, runny nose and sneezing, or the symptoms of urticaria (hives), like red, raised, itchy lumps on the skin. Allegra tablets 180mg have a long-lasting effect and are non sedative, (does not cause drowsiness), because the receptor binding action of fexofenadine is specific to peripheral H1 receptors in blood vessels rather than the H1 receptors in the central nervous system.

What does Allegra contain?

Allegra tablets 120mg contain the active ingredient fexofenadine, an antihistamine used to reduce symptoms of allergic rhinitis or urticaria (hives). They also contain starch, magnesium stearate and lactose. They also contain microcrystalline cellulose, pregelatinised maize starch, croscarmellose sodium, magnesium stearate, povidone, titanium dioxide (E171), colloidal silicon dioxide, macrogol 400, iron oxide, hypromellose.

What doses of Allegra are available?

Allegra tablets are available in 2 doses:
  • 60mg tablets in packets of 20 tablets
  • 180mg tablets in packets of 10 tablets

Treating allergy with Allegra

Allegra tablets 120mg contain the antihistamine fexofenadine that blocks the action of histamine, a chemical released during allergic reactions which causes small blood vessels to leak, allowing white blood cells and blood proteins into the tissues to respond to allergens like pollen, causing tissue swelling, over production of mucus and irritation. Allegra tablets 120mg are used to relieve symptoms of seasonal allergy like hay fever, perennial allergy (animal fur, mould and house dust mites), and urticaria (hives), and reduce the symptoms caused by the actions of histamine, like nasal congestion, itchy eyes, runny nose and sneezing in allergic rhinitis, and red, raised, itchy lumps on the skin in urticaria. Allegra tablets 120mg have a long-lasting effect and are non sedative, (does not cause drowsiness), because fexofenadine binds to specific to histamine (H1) receptors in blood vessels rather than in the central nervous system.

What are the side effects of Allegra?

Allegra tablets 120mg are generally well tolerated. The most commonly reported side effects when taking Allegra tablets 120mg include: fatigue, dizziness, drowsiness, nausea and headache.

When should Allegra not be used?

You should not use Allegra tablets 120mg if you:
  • are allergic to fexofenadine or any ingredients in Allegra tablets 120mg
  • are pregnant or breastfeeding, without discussion with your doctor
  • have taken an antacid containing aluminium and magnesium hydroxide within 2 hours
  • are taking medications like ketoconazole, erythromycin or cimetidine, which may increase the blood levels of fexofenadine

How should Allegra be taken?

You should take Allegra tablets 120mg with a glass of water once daily with or without food, for as long as recommended by your pharmacist.

Missed dose of Allegra

If you miss a dose of Allegra tablets 180mg take it as soon as you remember, unless it is time to take the next dose, then skip the missed dose. Do not take a double dose.

How should Allegra be stored?

You should keep your Allegra tablets 180mg in their blister packs until use. Store at room temperature below 25°C and keep protected from direct sunlight.

pm.expect(jsonData.value).is.to.equal("
TRUSTED ONLINE PHARMACY FOR 12 YEARS
Search for Medicine Here
 
Order from Home

Order medication from the comfort of your own home
No percription required
Discounts available for product purchases		 Authentic Medication

Authentic medication
Registered Pharmacists		 Worldwide Delivery

Free worldwide delivery
Orders are shipped daily

  ");

pm.expect(jsonData.value).is.to.equal(" SITE_NAME -> localhost || (AppConfig Name=\"ReceiptEMailFrom\") -> customerservices@inhousedrugstore.vu|| siteNAME -> \r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tlocalhost ||  SITE_URL -> https://www.inhousedrugstore.vu/ || (RANDOM) -> 2 || (HDRID) -> 2 ");

pm.expect(jsonData.value).is.to.equal("
About Us

localhost:44347 is one of the worlds original and longest standing online pharmacies established in 1996. We only supply non-restricted medicines that we source from FDA approved manufacturers.

Our aim is to offer you the same top quality product that you might purchase locally, but at a more affordable price.


Our Quality Assurance

We purchase either directly from the manufacturer or from reputable pharmaceutical wholesalers. All medications listed are the authentic brand names unless otherwise stated e.g. generics. Medications are shipped using their original packaging with safety seals and registered trademarks. We do not ever repackage the products unless the product is sold in blister strips (but we list this clearly).

In some cases you may perceive that the packaging is different compared to what you are used to. This is due to where in the world the medication is manufactured; US manufactured products may be packaged in bottles compared to UK packaged product in blister strips and a box. Every product on our website has a product image which can be enlarged so you will know what to expect on delivery.

Generic alternatives are clearly stated and only sourced from FDA approved manufacturing facilities. We offer these in addition to the branded products as a more affordable alternative if this is important to you.

Please be assured that the products are of the highest quality purchased from reputable sources.

Shipping

All orders are processed and shipped from our South Pacific facility. We process orders every day and aim to dispatch most orders within 24 hours of you placing the order. We will email a shipping confirmation to the email address you provide and where appropriate for the shipping method you choose, we will include a track and trace number.

The time it takes to deliver your order depends on the shipping method you choose.

Please be aware that your order can become delayed in your country’s customs department. If customs hold your order, pending import duties and taxes may become applicable and they could hold your order for up to 14 days prior to contacting you. While we understand any inconvenience this may place on you, please avoid delays by ordering with sufficient time.

Refunds

Please see our genuine Shipping & Return Policy

Payment Options

We accept Visa, MasterCard and American Express credit cards. USA resident customers may also pay by eCheck using services provided by TheECheck.com. Use the currency selector at the top of our web page to choose your preferred currency.

For other payment options please contact us by email or telephone and we may be able to assist with alternatives for your country.



Physical Address:

Pacific Health Limited
Eluk Road
Pango
Port Vila
Vanuatu



Postal Address:


Payment Options

We accept Visa, MasterCard and American Express credit cards. USA resident customers may also pay by eCheck using services provided by TheECheck.com. Use the currency selector at the top of our web page to choose your preferred currency.

For other payment options please contact us by email or telephone and we may be able to assist with alternatives for your country.



Physical Address:

Pacific Health Limited
P.O. Box 337
Port Vila
Vanuatu
");

exec: //There needs to be a cart for this request, so the following is required for the AddItemToCart prerequisites
//AddItemToCart (sets {{cartItem.CartId}} environment value which is used as Params in this request.)
// Parameter cartItem.cartId is required for section= 'checkout' only, as the other sections do not need cartId parameter to be passed. CartId will be ignored for other sections.

// If customer is not signed in or CreateCustomer has not been requested, then Age term will be returned. Uncomment the correlating test section below if no customer has been created (will return Age term), or if customer has been created (will not return Age term)
//Tests that the response has all keys present at parent level
//Tests that the array has all keys present at websiteTerms level
pm.test("Schema Details are present for websiteTerms", () => {
//Comment out the sections below not in the request
//checkout - anonymous customer with no customer created (age has not been set in prior API request)
pm.test("Checkout - response includes all terms", function () {

pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[0].description).is.to.equal("I confirm the medications on this order are for my personal use, a close family member, or an animal under my care, and does not exceed 90 days supply. I understand orders placed in excess of this quantity risk seizure by Customs [To calculate 90 days supply, multiply your daily dose by 90].");

pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[1].description).is.to.equal("The medications I am purchasing are in accordance with advice from my healthcare professional. I have not used this site as a substitute for proper medical advice.");

pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[2].description).is.to.equal("I would like to be notified about any important changes so I can easily contact you or re-order in the future. This choice can be changed at any time.");

pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[3].description).is.to.equal("I understand that my order will ship once international air postal services resume. Placing my order now reserves my 
items and gives me shipping priority over orders placed later. I am expecting my order to ship around April 23rd, but 
this is subject to when international postal services resume. Once my order is shipped it will take 2- 4 weeks for 
delivery depending on postal congestion.");
pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[4].description).is.to.equal("I confirm that I am over 18 years of age.");
pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[5].description).is.to.equal("Please keep me informed about discounts and new payment methods that may benefit me. This choice can be changed at any time.");
pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[6].description).is.to.equal("I would like to receive promotions about special offers via Facebook and other social media. This choice can be changed at any time.");

pm.expect(jsonData.websiteTerms[7].description).is.to.equal("We have always taken customer privacy very seriously and you have legal rights to be informed as to how we use your personal information. Our privacy statement has been updated since your previous order. This order will be processed in compliance with that privacy statement.");
//Tests that extended info is present for website terms

request.description: This method is used to get the web site terms for customer. Section Name is the main attribute to get the Terms, CartID is used for Checkout process only Following sections are used For Cookies section :- Section Name is AllCookies.Gets all the terms used for cookies consents For SignIn section :- SectionName is SignIn.Gets all the optional terms as is. No need to check with customer terms.This also gets the AGE term during SignIN. For MyPreferences section :- SectionName is EditConsent.Gets all the optional terms only after checking if these are checked or not EditConsent section is just used while saving the terms not reteriving the terms for reteriving the terms in my account section for EDITConsent different approch is used to reterive the customer term as using edit consent section was not working fine in some scenarioes For Checkout section :- SectionName is Checkout.Gets the Optional Terms which are not checked.Get all the manadatory terms along with Age but show the Age control to get the age of user term only if customer is not registered Note :- All registered users will have DOB and Age term checked while login so need to show Age Manadotry term if registered user *Note:- The UI suggests that the cartId is required but it is opitional. Use 0 in case not known to try this out.*

exec: //GetWebsiteTerms - IMPORTANT: needs to have been sent with the same sectionName as you are wanting to request in this API Body, so that environment variables are created.

//Copy/paste the desired sectionName code from Pre-request script section into the Body (pre-request section is being used as a repository in this API, as comments left in the Body are sent in the request)

//This test is set up to send the body as RAW JSON and with content-type header as application/json. This is due to the array model for 'websiteTerms' not sending properly using x-www-form-urlencoded via postman (current postman defect for arrays)
//To see the request output view Console Request Body

//allcookies - this sectionName will return as a fail, as it is not meant to save to the database. This is by design, and returns 500 Internal Server Error "Web Service Exception:: No proper section available to save"
//Use this to see if a value is included anywhere in the response
//Tests that the array has all keys present at parent level
//They are stored here to act as a library to use in the Body

//Each sectionName is below to copy/paste to Body. (as the Body for JSON does not work with duplicate sectionNames with code commented out... it sends the whole text every request... ignores the comment punctuation)

//allcookies - this sectionName will return as a fail, as it is not meant to save to the database. This is by design, and returns 500 Internal Server Error "Web Service Exception:: No proper section available to save"
//Note: this sectionName will return a 500 error with "Web Service Exception:: No proper section available to save" by design, as it is not meant to save to the database.

request.description: Section Name is the main attribute to save the Terms Following sections are used For SignIn section :- SectionName is SignIn. This also requires AGE term during SignIN.
